h3. Workaround

h4. Option 1:
# Change title of the page to be moved.
(i) i.e. "Release Notes" to "Release Notes v1.0".
# Move page to desired location.
(i) The new title can be changed back to the original after completion.

h4. Option 2:
# Check the error in the logs to find the space that contains the deleted page (this may not be the same space as the page you are moving).
# Purge the trash in that space ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Purging+Deleted+Pages]). 
(!) When the trash is purged, all attachments on purged pages are permanently removed as well.

h4. Option 3:
# Clone the page via _Tools_ > _Copy_ and save the page.
(i) The title of the page will be "Copy of <page_title>".
# Move cloned page to desired location.
(i) You may rename the title page to the original after moving operation is successful by removing the "Copy of" words from the title. 
# Delete the old page (can't be moved) to remove redundancies.
fields.summary: Page move fails because of a deleted page

My workflow follows:

1. Track time in external application.
2. Apply time in JIRA at period end.
3. Browse to Timesheet page.
4. Click "Log Work" to open Log Work screen (see attached).
5. Set the date to the first day of the time period.
6. Enter the date (by clicking and selecting or typing; both are slow).

Confluence will send an email to the a user who can grant permissions - this will be either the last user (with appropriate permissions) to edit the page, the page creator or a space admin. Confluence will try each of these roles in turn, emailing the first user that has appropriate permissions.

In some cases, Confluence users sometimes watched content unintentionally and they might not know how to unwatched the page. When this occurred, Confluence administrators will need to identify the page, access the space and disable the user subscription.

Confluence could help its admin greatly if notification management is centralised in Confluence administrators menu. It could help administrator in the following ways:

* Confluence administrators would be able to control every users notification in one menu
** Find the user, when the user selected, the menu will listed all the subscription of the selected user
* This central notification management menu will allow Confluence administrators to disable users subscription to any contents or enabling it
* When Confluence administrators disable users subscription it will trigger an approval notification to the users if the user agrees to it, the subscription will be remove
** If this option is un-tick, the subscription will be disabled without approval. This is necessary if the content is a sensitive content

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34569].
  {panel}

Currently, requests for access are sent to just one person:

bq. Confluence will send an email to the a user who can grant permissions - this will be either the last user (with appropriate permissions) to edit the page, the page creator or a space admin. 

If that one person is not available (i.e. on leave) then the request won't get actioned until he/she is back. The person who made the request has no way of knowing if their request has been reviewed. For example, the e-mail to the person who can grant access is generated from a system e-mail address and the out of office auto-reply from the approver would get sent to this email instead of to the person making the request.

A potential solution is allowing Space admins to elect for requests be sent to all space administrators, or allowing the system administrators to decide whether to send request access e-mails to all space administrators instead of the current logic would resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Allow request for access recipients to be chosen

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34533].
  {panel}

When playing an embedded youtube video, inserted into a Confluence page using the Widget Connector, using Chrome it does not have the fullscreen button. I have tested this in the reported 5.4.3 and verified it still behaves this way in 5.5.4

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Embed a Youtube video into a Confluence page using the Widget Connector
# In Chrome, navigate to the page and play the video
# There will be no fullscreen button in the bottom right corner

h3. Expected behavior
There should be a fullscreen button in the bottom right corner.

h3. Actual behavior
There is no fullscreen button in the bottom right corner of the video.

h3. Related Notes
* The fullscreen button does appear using Safari and Firefox.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to not use the Widget Connector, but embed the YouTube video directly in the page using the (disabled by default) HTML Macro

# Enable the [HTML Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html]
# Go to a page you want to have a YouTube video embedded
# Add an empty HTML Macro to the page
# Go to the YouTube video you want to embed
# Click the Share button in the video
# Click the Embed Tab
# Copy the full HTML code provided
# Paste that into the HTML Macro in the Confluence page
# Save the Page
fields.summary: Embedded Youtube Fullscreen Button Missing in Chrome

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34510].
  {panel}

I would like a way to view all inline comments at once. This is mostly related to how I like to consume content and is a personal thing, but I think it's worth raising anyway (I doubt I'm alone).

I read a page and then scroll down through the comments. I don't read every one, but rather a few things will prompt me to read a particular comment:
# The name of the commenter - if it's someone with interesting opinions I'm more likely to want to read what they have to say
# The ones with lots of replies
# The ones that start with interesting phrases like 'I disagree', 'let me play devils advocate' etc
# The long comments where people are obviously passionate about the topic
# Ones that have a standout sentence in bold or a headline or something eye catching
# Inline comments that are _unresolved_

With inline comments, I can't immediately see if a little yellow bar has 80 passionate comments underneath it, and unless I click on every highlighted word, I'm likely to miss out on important discussion. I feel like I can scan down a page and get a vibe from the page comments too, which I'm now missing with inline comments.

For me, I feel like it's taken away some of the inclusive and easy nature of collaboration that Confluence is amazing for.

Ideas:
# Have a way as the author to change an inline comment into a page comment, and start it with the highlighted text in a quote. That way if something becomes a vital discussion it can be moved to a place it will be more visible to casual page viewers
# Have a 'view all' button that does the above for all inline comments for the current viewer only
# Have a user setting that does the above for all pages by default (ie disable inline comments per user)
# Display a count of comments in the top right of the highlighted text so it's easy to see where the discussion is
fields.summary: View all inline comments at once

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34498].
  {panel}

A customer has experienced using [Confluence manual installation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Manually] and using [Confluence installation wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+on+Windows] (.exe). He has praised the installation wizard speeds up the upgrade process tremendously but would like to include a few suggestion and improvements.

*1. Modification logs claimed it is not clear enough*
* From his description, the logs statement is not being very clear. For example, the log says MySQL jdbc driver is not added into the file and requires to be applied manually, but in fact the previous jdbc driver file still exist.
** there should have an additional checking if the jdbc driver already exist in the folder.

*2. Installer should also check for {{conf/}} and {{/bin}} modifications, since we will have several modifications*
* setenv.sh, setenv.bat, server.xml, web.xml and others

*3.The wizard compares and copies modification files to another folder*
* compared file with differences will by copied into a new folder. Example:
** {{changes/conf/server.xml-modifications}}
** {{changes/bin/setenv.sh-modifications}}

*4. The wizard prompts to replace modified files to installation directory*
* After step 3, installer prompts if user wants to copy the modified files into installation directory or not (one by one)
** it's like copying "test.txt" into another folder with "test.txt" file exist in Windows, it will then prompt if you want to replace or not.
!http://i.stack.imgur.com/Iz7Dr.png!

It sounds tedious and I am sure there are several factors we need to take into consideration, but if done correctly, it may save Confluence administrators other amount of time to re-customize Confluence and configuration settings.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34397].
  {panel}

h4.Scenario A (single user restriction, single page):
Create a page without any child pages, and monitor the index queue. Add a view restriction to a single user, and notice that the index queue now has *3 entries added*

h4.Scenario B (multiple user restriction, single page):
Create a page without any child pages, and monitor the index queue. Add 2 view restrictions to 2 separate users, and notice that the index queue now has *6 entries added*

h4.Scenario C (multiple user restriction, page with 1 child):
Create a page, and add a child page, and monitor the index queue. Add 2 view restrictions to 2 separate users (to the parent page), and notice that the index queue now has *12 entries added*

h4.Scenario D (single group restriction, page with 1 child):
Create a page, and add a child page, and monitor the index queue. Add 1 view restriction to 1 group (to the parent page), and notice that the index queue now has *6 entries added*

Notice from the scenarios above that the index queue is doubled, if you add a similar restriction to another user, on the same page, and that this effect is *compounded with every child page*. This is compounded for every attachment as well. 

This is a serious performance impact on many large instances, especially when they are affected by this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-16866 . Some instances' queue entries may grow to a really large number in a very short time, resulting in outages, as the index cannot be cleared with subsequent flushes.

h3.Workaround
Utilize Scenario D. Add the individual users you wish to restrict individually into a group instead, and restrict the pages to a group.
fields.summary: Combine Multiple Individual User Restrictions In 1 Index Queue Entry

h3. Summary
Images in tables that are not manually sized increase in size or are missing when exported to PDF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in a Confluence Page
# Insert an image in one of the cells
# Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The exported PDF matches what is displayed in the page when viewed

h3. Actual Results
The small image is displayed much larger than its actual size or the image is missing in the table.

h3. Workaround
Updated on Feb 21 2018: the original workaround is not available anymore in the current version of Confluence Cloud.
Minimizing the image can solve the issue in PDF, but this workaround will affect the view in wiki.
h3. Original Workaround
# Edit page with the image
# Click on image, resize to any size *use the _px_ value* . i.e. :
!Screen Shot 2015-04-17 at 3.03.42 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Press enter to apply the change to the image
# Click on image again, resize back to the desired size i.e. :
!Screen Shot 2015-04-17 at 3.03.59 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Press enter to apply the change and save page
# Export page to PDF
fields.summary: Embedded images placed inside of a table are not displaying properly when page is exported to PDF
